issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: TiAPI
components.description: This component is used for cross-platform API work. Specifications are most likely to use this component.

fields.description:
Using 3.1 GA and the Android map module that uses Google Maps v2 sdk - Pretty much this Q&A sums it up: https://developer.appcelerator.com/question/152214/google-map-v2-sdk-310-ga-map-appears-blanck

I've taken sample code, my own, etc. and the map is always blank, even with the appropriate key from the Google Console.

Testing with an HTC One on 4.1.2
fields.summary: Map module is blank in samples.

comments.body: Ok I think I figured this one out.  If you just use the key generated in the Google Console you have to build the app for production.  Just building for device won't work.  If you use the debug keystore then it will work for building for device.
Closing due to inactivity. If this issue still exists, please raise a new ticket
